alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 4:34PM EDT until June 27 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain has ended, with additional rainfall amounts less than 0.5 inches possible. However, flash flooding may still be ongoing or begin shortly as the heavy rainfall works down area streams. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bowie... Severn... Crofton... Severna Park... Odenton... Fort Meade... Millersville... Gambrills... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
